div.head: To the Reader.
div.p: IT is not a thirst of empty glory that makes me runne hazard of your censure, but a consideration of the weaknesse of School▪ masters, who undertake to read the Greek Orators to raw Schollers, themselves being not ripe in the Attick customes. I have therefore so far endeavoured as you see. If any thing may afford a scruple to any, he shall engage me that will require satisfaction. If any thing seem amisse, it shall be taken by me as a favour to hear of it from any. For I am not of those whose eares are stopt, when their errors are told them. If this please it shall adde spurres to the finishing of this course intended; and as occasion may give leave, you shall have the rest that may be spoken.
